analytic.title: To my worthily esteemed Friend, Mr. IAMES HAYVVARD, upon his Translation of Eromena

monogr.title: Eromena, or, Love and revenge. Written originally in the Thoscan tongue, by Cavalier Gio. Francesco Biondi, Gentleman extraordinary of his Majesties Privie Chamber. Divided into six books. And now faithfully Englished, by Ia. Hayvvard, of Graies-Inne Gent
monogr.author: Biondi, Giovanni Francesco, Sir

keywords.term: Dictionaries, vocabularies, phrase books, instruction in foreign languages

div.head: To my worthily esteemed Friend, Mr. IAMES HAYVVARD, upon his Translation of Eromena 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
div.l: FAire Eromena in her Thoscan tyre,
I view'd, & lik'd the fashion wondrous well;
But in this change of habit I admire,
That still in her the same perfections dwell:
So have I seen Transalpin grafts to grow,
And beare rare fruit, remov'd to Thames from Po.
